Text: Maybe I don't understand what's involved in uploading torrents, but this is the second time you've uploaded this torrent in less than a month and you're not seeding either one of them. How is anyone supposed to download it?

00sweeney:  I don't know what went wrong with the first one -- uTorrent told me it has missing or corrupted files, so i made a new one.  As far as I can tell, three people are downloading this one.  Let me know if I'm doing anything wrong.

OOsweeney:  uTorrent said first one was corrupted so I made a new one.  As far as I can tell, three people are downloading this one now.  Let me know if I'm doing anything wrong.  I don't know what my upload speed is, but it can't be great.

I just looked at the first episode and I wanted to give a head's up about the quality--it's very bad. It looks worse than if someone used a video camera to tape their TV broadcast--which is what looks like happened. There are hard coded subtitles, the picture is very bad and the audio is out of synch. Diogenes, I'm not trying to be a jerk, and I've never uploaded anything, let alone something this ambitious--but this is a HUGE download and people need to know what the quality is before they commit that much time and space on their hard drive. I think this is completely unwatchable. Sorry.
The second episode seems slightly better than the first, but it's still not very good. And the subtitles are very distracting.

For die-hard fans from the fan communities only.  For a sample, download episode #1, which is about the worst quality episode.  About 1/3 of all of them have hard-coded (Swedish?) subtitles.  Many, many, many thanks to the original uploaders who took the time to transfer their old VHS tapes to digital (the only way many of us die-hard fans in the world can see SB again).  First half of 1985's episodes to come soon.
